meanings.sent1: During the game, he made a blooper by tripping over his own feet.
meanings.sent2: She realized her blooper when she accidentally deleted the important file.
meanings.sent3: The blooper he made while trying to juggle oranges left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her blooper in the presentation was like a bright red flag waving for attention.
meanings.sent5: The blooper in the recipe caused the cake to turn out completely wrong.

meanings.definition: A funny or embarrassing mistake made during the filming of a movie or television show.
meanings.sent1: The blooper reel at the end of the movie showed all the funny mistakes the actors made.
meanings.sent2: The director couldn't stop laughing at the blooper where the actor forgot his lines.
meanings.sent3: The blooper of the actor wearing the wrong costume had everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her blooper on set was like a burst of unexpected laughter in a serious scene.
meanings.sent5: The blooper of the prop falling over added a touch of humor to the film.
